messages.title: Our Plan for Britain
messages.content:
A global, outward-looking Britain
A stronger economy where everyone plays by the same rules
A fairer society where success is based on merit, not privilege
A united nation we're all proud to call home

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Implement Theresa May's Plan for Britain after we leave the EU.
Ensure that Wirral NHS receives a fair share of extra cash and has new radiotherapy units by 2020.
Work for real residents all year round, regardless of who they voted for.
Halt the decline of local shopping centers and do more to encourage new investment here.
Support retired and elderly residents by protecting pensions and by doing more to tackle isolation.
Improve access for rail users at Wallasey Village station.
Regeneration of New Brighton and other areas, and a focus on particular local issues such as the status of the site near Groves Road.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour has had the seat for 25 years. Tactics for a change.

leaflet.personalStatement: Introducing Andy Livesey: a builder by trade and dad to four children.

endorsements.endorser: Councillors Lesley Rennie, Paul Hayes, Ian Lewis
endorsements.endorsement: Meet Andy Livesey, the new Conservative candidate for Wallasey.

quotes.text: The latest poll shows that many hardcore anti-Brexit Labour voters are switching to the Liberal Democrats, who are the pure anti-Brexit party.
Backing for the Lib Dems suggests that their anti-Brexit strategy is apparently luring Labour Remain voters away from supporting that party.

images.caption: The Government's Rail Minister came to Wallasey Village station last month as part of their campaign to see improved access for rail users.
A vote for UKIP in Wallasey is a wasted vote. They can't win here.

examples: NHS spent 98.4 billion in 2013/14 and will reach 133 billion by 2020.
272,000 diagnosed with cancer carried out in 2010/11 to 322,000 in 2014/15.
340,00 new attendances at Cancer Centre LBC.
Support for UKIP is also down.
Every vote for Labour candidate in Wallasey is a vote to put Jeremy Corbyn into Downing Street.
150,000 set aside to ensure local authority provides the improvements.
The EU referendum result was an instruction to change the way our country works.
We will make a success of Brexit.
Guarantee everyone born privileged or poor will be secure.
The plan will ensure a strong economy and society.
A fairer society where success is based on merit, not privilege.
A global, outward-looking Britain.
A united nation we're all proud to call home.
